bibl.title: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, April 20, 1921

div1.p: Rose thanks Carter for his impressions of the yellow fever situation in West Africa. He sends him an outline of a conference concerning the Yellow Fever Commission report as well as Noguchi's Leptospira icteroides work.

div1.head: Letter from Wickliffe Rose to Henry Rose Carter, April 20, 1921

April 20, 1921
Dear Doctor Carter:
div1.p:
I wish to thank you very heartily for your
letter of April 18 giving me your impressions concern-
ing report of the yellow fever commission and the yel-
low fever situation in West Africa. This letter I re-
gard as a distinct contribution to the report; it will
be useful to us when the Board comes to consider this
report at its May meeting.

You will be interested to know that Doctor
White, Doctor Flexner, Doctor Noguchi and I had a con-
ference at the Institute yesterday. In addition to
discussion of the report of the yellow fever commission,
Doctor White had opportunity to go over with Doctor No-
guchi the material in his laboratory in connection with
the Leptospira Icteroides. For your information I am
enclosing outline of this conference.
Again thanking you for this letter,
div1.closer:
Very sincerely yours, Wickliffe Rose. Doctor H R Carter
2121 California st. N W
Washington D C
